qas.question: What is the primary motivation for migration?
Which birds will not migrate if they are well fed through winter?
When do the birds return to warmer regions?
what do the longer days of summer provide the birds?

answers.text: time for breeding birds to feed their young.

qas.question: What do diurnal birds produce as opposed to non migratory species?

context: The primary motivation for migration appears to be <a0_0>food<a0_0/>; for example, some <a1_0>hummingbirds<a1_0/> choose not to migrate if fed through the winter. Also, the longer days of the northern summer provide extended <a3_0>time for breeding birds to feed their young.<a3_0/> This helps diurnal birds to produce <a4_0>larger clutches<a4_0/> than related non-migratory species that remain in the tropics. As the days shorten in <a2_0>autumn<a2_0/>, the birds return to warmer regions where the available food supply varies little with the season.
